Content: Which TWO statements can be represented by the expression 4 × 8?

A.Choice: A teacher puts 8 chairs at each of 4 tables.

B.Choice: Tom buys 4 red markers and 8 black markers.

C.Choice: Marie shares her 8 marbles equally among 4 friends.

D.Choice: There are 4 rows of flowers. There are 8 flowers in each row.

E.Choice: There are 8 ducks in the pond. Then, 4 more ducks join them.

Content: Ana starts eating lunch at 12:15 p.m. She finishes eating lunch 40 minutes later.
Which clock shows the time that Ana finishes eating lunch?
:ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS THREE PARTS.
Nolan has 16 pennies in one jar and 94 pennies in another jar.
He uses some of the pennies to buy a pencil that costs 25 cents. What is the total number of pennies Nolan has left after he buys the pencil? Show your work.
Nolan saves some more pennies and now has 187 pennies all in none jar. He finds 10 more pennies in his pocket.
What is the total number of pennies Nolan has after he adds the 10 pennies from his pocket to the jar?
The table shows the number of pennies Nolan saved each week for four weeks.
problems/ILG3M/media/3a.jpg
What is the total number of pennies Nolan saved during the four weeks? Show your work.
Each model equals one whole divided into equal parts. Which models show 1/4 shaded?
Select the THREE correct answers.
Which number line shows the correct location of the number 5/3?
Use the information provided to answer Part A and Part B for this question.
Cindy is finding the quotient for 27 ÷ 9. She says, “The answer is 18 because addition is the opposite of division and 9 + 18 = 27.”
Identify the incorrect reasoning in Cindy's statement.
Show or explain how Cindy can correct her reasoning. Find the quotient when 27 is divided by 9.
Select the THREE equations that are correct.
Use the information provided to answer Part A and Part B for this question.
Mr. Conley delivers packages. The bar graph shows the total number of packages he delivered on five days last week.
problems/ILG3M/media/8a.jpg
What is the total number of packages Mr. Conley delivered on Monday and Tuesday?
How many MORE packages did Mr. Conley deliver on Monday and Tuesday than he did on Thursday and Friday?
Sandy draws a shape. She divides it into parts. Each part is 1/8 the area of the shape. Which shape could be the one Sandy draws?
Carla buys apples and peaches at the store. The mass of the apples is 724 grams. The mass of the peaches is 471 grams.
How much greater is the mass, in grams, of the apples than the mass of the peaches?
A model of a playground is shown.
problems/ILG3M/media/11a.jpg
Find the area, in square meters, of the playground. Explain your answer using an equation or equations.
Which THREE statements can be represented by the expression 24 ÷ 4 ?

A.Choice: Jake makes 242 muffins. He gives away 4 muffins.

B.Choice: Collin has 24 toy trucks. He sorts them into groups of 4 trucks each.

C.Choice: Amira has 24 trading cards. She puts them into piles containing 4 cards each.

D.Choice: Rosemary puts 24 stickers in each book. She uses enough stickers to fill 4 books.

E.Choice: Steven fills a new bookshelf with 24 books. He puts the same number of books on each of the 4 shelves.

Content: Which TWO ways show how to find the value of 7 × 40?
Select the TWO correct answers.
Answer Part A and Part B for this question.
Third-grade students took a total of 1,000 pictures for the yearbook during the school year.

:ibox:• Ted took 72 pictures.

• Mary took 48 pictures.
What is the total number of pictures taken by the rest of the third-grade students during the school year?
Ella took 8 more pictures than Ted took. How many more pictures did Ella take than Mary?
A tablet has a rectangular screen with a width of 7 inches and a length of 9 inches. Select the THREE ways to calculate the area of the screen, in square inches.
Gina's bedroom floor is in the shape of a rectangle. It is 10 feet long and 9 feet wide. What is the area of Gina's bedroom floor?
Select the TWO shapes that have parts that are each 1/6 of the area of the whole shape.
Select the equation that is true when the number 8 is put into the box.
Answer the subtraction problem below.
Use the information provided to answer Part A and Part B for this question.
An artist plans to paint a wall in a room. The wall is divided into 6 equal parts so that each part can be painted a different color.
problems/ILG3M/media/20a.jpg
The artist goes to the store to buy brushes and small cans of paint. He pays a total of $94.

:ibox:• He buys 8 brushes that cost $5 each.

• The rest of the money is used for the 6 cans of paint. Each can of paint costs the same amount.
How much does each can of paint cost? Show your work or explain your answer.
The artist starts painting the wall. The parts of the wall that look white are not painted yet.
problems/ILG3M/media/20b.jpg
Which statements about the wall are correct?
Select the TWO correct statements.

A.Choice: Each painted part is 1/4 of the whole wall.

B.Choice: Each painted part is 1/6 of the whole wall.

C.Choice: Each painted part is 2/4 of the whole wall.of the whole wall.

D.Choice: The fraction of the wall not yet painted is 1/6.

E.Choice: The fraction of the wall not yet painted is 2/4.

F.Choice: The fraction of the wall not yet painted is 2/6.

Content: Mia placed point P on the number line.
problems/ILG3M/media/21a.jpg

:ibox:• Give the value of the number P as a fraction.

• What does the denominator of your fraction represent on the number line?

• What does the numerator of your fraction represent on the number line?
Which THREE comparisons are true?
Which THREE shapes are quadrilaterals?
Select the THREE fractions that make this comparison true.
Lavina wants to place a fence around a rectangular play area for her rabbits. The paly area will be 7 feet long and 4 feet weide.
What is the total length of fence, in feet, Lavina needs to place around the paly area?
Jana gets a sticker for every 5 minutes she spends on her chores each day. She puts them on a picture graph as shown.
problems/ILG3M/media/26a.jpg
Jana spends a total of 130 minutes doing chores during the week. How many stickers should Jana get on Friday? T
Use the information provided to answer Part A and Part B for this question.
Tori and Leo set up their clubhouse with four tables. These rectangles represent the tabletops.
problems/ILG3M/media/27a.jpg
problems/ILG3M/media/27b.jpg
problems/ILG3M/media/27c.jpg
problems/ILG3M/media/27d.jpg
Identify TWO tabletops with the same area, in square feet, and explain how you know that the areas are equal.
The grid shows Table C and Table D placed end to end to make a new, larger tabletop.
problems/ILG3M/media/27e.jpg
Tori uses the expression 3 × (2 + 4) to find the total area of the new, larger tabletop.
Leo uses the expression (3 × 2) + (3 × 4) to find the total area of the new, larger tabletop.

:ibox:• Find the total area, in square feet, of the new, larger tabletop.

• Explain why both Tori's expression and Leo's expression are expression.
Jane bought 24 light bulbs. The light bulbs come in packs of 4.
How many packs of light bulbs did Jane buy?
Which THREE figures each have an area of 12 square inches?
Select the THREE correct answers.
problems/ILG3M/media/29a.jpg
Use the information provided to answer Part A and Part B for this question.
The owners of a new toy store have 888 puzzles to sell.

:ibox:• They sell 237 puzzles the first month.

• They sell 461 puzzles the second month.
Which of these shows the three given numbers, each rounded to the nearest 10?
Use the rounded numbers to find about how many puzzles the owners have left to sell.
Which equations are true?
Select the THREE correct answers.
Which number line shows a point at 8/8?
Eric measures 10 leaves with a ruler. He records the lengths as shown.
Which line plot shows the lengths of the leaves recorded correctly?
